item.title: Brooke Shields - Age, Family, Bio
Does Murray Die at the End of 'Stranger Things' Season 4? All Was Revealed With Vol. 2
item.description: Season 4, Vol. 2 of 'Stranger Things' is finally streaming on Netflix! Fans are already nervous about the fate of Murray Bauman. Does he die? Source: NetflixAfter waiting for what felt like centuries (aka three years), the Duffer Brothers blessed us with Season 4, Vol. 1 of their hit '80s-set sci-fi Netflix series Stranger Things on May 27, 2022. We get to enjoy the shenanigans of the core Demogorgan-fighting group — Mike (Finn Wolfhard), Will (Noah Schnapp), Lucas (Caleb McLaughlin), Dustin (Gaten Matarazzo), Max (Sadie Sink), and Eleven (Millie Bobby Brown) — while seeing the arrival of new characters like nihilistic Hellfire Club leader Eddie Munson (Joseph Quinn) and the almighty, soul-sucking humanoid creature Vecna (Jamie Campbell Bower).

item.title: Full List Of Winners At The Oscars 2022
item.description: Last night was another moment of celebration for individuals in the global entertainment industry as they smiled home with awards from the 94th Academy awards otherwise known as OSCARS. The award event Naija News understands was held on Sunday at the Dolby Theatre. Presentation of awards to final nominees was done by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. Naija News recalls that names of nominees were announced in early February 2022 and the presentation of awards to successful nominees was done on March 27 at the ceremony hosted by Regina Hall, Amy Schumer and Wanda Sykes.

item.title: Hassan Lemu: Babban sakataren Sardauna ya rasu yana da shekaru 95
item.description: Allah yayi wa Alhaji Hassan Lemu tsohon babban sakataren firimiyan Arewa Sir Ahmadu Bello Sardauna rasuwa a garin Minna da misalin karfe 8:45 na dare yana da shekaru 95. Daya daga cikin yayansa mai suna Salihu Hassan Lemu ne ya sanar da rasuwar mahaifin nasu, inda yace yayi fama da ciwo, hakan yasa suka mika shi asibiti don samun kulawa, a can ya cika. KU KARANTA: Kungiyar Izala zata gina cibiyar koyar da sana’o’i

item.title: 'Tick, Tick...Boom!' Hype Has People Questioning How Jonathan Larson Died
item.description: Jonathan Larson, who is the subject of 'Tick, Tick...Boom!', died at a young age, and many want to know exactly how the composer died. Source: YouTubeRent is already a legendary musical, but now, the man who composed it is about to become a little more well-known. Jonathan Larson, the man behind Rent, is also the subject of Hamilton creator Lin-Manuel Miranda's directorial debut, Tick, Tick...Boom!. The movie follows a version of Larson as he struggles to make ends meet and works on a wide variety of musical theater projects.

item.title: Bachelorette Contestant Kirk Bryant Is a Football Coach
item.description: In ‘The Bachelorette’ Season 19, contestant Kirk Bryant turns heads as the Texas Tech football coach, but how far does he get on the reality series? Spoiler alert: This article contains spoilers for The Bachelorette Season 19. Season 19 of The Bachelorette might have the most drama from any season so far. That’s because this season, there are two season leads, which gives the men vying for the Bachelorette’s hearts a little more power.

item.title: Binance Responds To Unusual Currency Fluctuations
item.description: Prominent crypto trading platform, Binance, has modified its trading procedures to counteract an abnormal currency fluctuation, while also dissociating itself from the forex crisis in Nigeria. Recall the Federal Government had reportedly blocked the major online crypto platforms to avert the continuous manipulation of the forex market and illicit movement of funds. Naija News reports that the latest development comes after the National Security Adviser, Nuhu Ribadu, ordered a crackdown on currency speculators in the country.

item.title: Who Is RHOC Star Katie Ginella's First Husband? Details
item.description: Co-Parenting Ain't Easy: Who Is Katie Ginella's First Husband, Andrew Sundseth?Katie is currently happily married to sports journalist Matt Ginella, with whom she shares one child, Bandon Ginella. By Sheridan SingletonPublished July 26 2024, 5:10 p.m. ET Source: BravoSeason 18 of Bravo's The Real Housewives of Orange County has brought forth new and interesting issues that this group of orange holders must contend with. The drama between Alexis Bellino, who is technically only a friend of the housewives, and Shannon Storms Beador continues to be as perplexing as it is annoying, even drawing comparisons to an early '90s thriller movie.

item.title: Disregard information about Buhari's death - Presidency tells Nigerians
item.description: - The presidency spoke out concerning the news of President Muhammadu Buhari's alleged death as further speculated by a British politician - Garba Shehu released a series of tweets stating the true position of the situation of the president who is in London The information revealed by British politician Eric Joyce that Nigeria’s President Muhammadu Buhari is dead is not true, the presidency has revealed. item.title: Kim Kardashian Will Be Shutting Down KKW Beauty to Create a New Brand Identity
item.description: What is Kim Kardashian's KKW Beauty brand's new name? After announcing that she will be shutting down operations, fans are wondering what to expect. Source: Instagram/@kimkardashianOut with the old and in with the new! Kim Kardashian has made bank off her beauty line KKW Beauty over the years. With offerings that range from highlight and contour kits to eyeshadow palettes to body products, and more, KKW Beauty has quickly become one of the most popular brands to shop.

item.title: What Happened to Rebs and Abdul on 'GBBO' During Bread Week?
item.description: Did Rebs and Abdul Intentionally Miss Bread Week on 'The Great British Bake Off'?By Jennifer TisdaleOct. 3 2022, Published 11:13 p.m. ET Source: NetflixRebs and Abdul from 'GBBO' It's a universally known truth that Bread Week is the most difficult for all Great British Bake Off contestants. This is due largely in part to, or entirely because of, judge Paul Hollywood who is the king of bread. His steely blue eyes watch the hands of every baker as they deftly and/or awkwardly knead whatever bread concoction they are tasked with creating.

item.title: Ainsley Weber - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Relatable TikTok personality and content creator who rose to fame by posting point-of-view style videos on her self titled account. She has amassed more than 370,000 fans on the platform. Before Fame In early 2018, she shared a cover performance of the song "Feeling Good" on YouTube. Trivia Her TikToks have received more than 8 million likes.  Family Life In April 2019, she posted a TikTok of her and her father dancing to Old Town Road.

item.title: Liquorose's Fans Rain 'Heavy' Curses On Emmanuel In Leaked Audio
item.description: Ahead of the BBNaija ‘Shine Ya Eye’ Reunion show, some fans of Liquorose have rained curses on her colleague and ex-lover Emmanuel. The relationship between Emmanuel and Liquorose was one of the ‘Ships’ of the season that many Nigerians had rooted for and consistently surprised them with lots of gifts. However, at a time many fans were looking forward to a wedding, the reality TV stars dashed their hopes as they ended their relationship.

item.title: Moses Hacmon - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Conceptual artist who has gained fame for his focus on the study of the subject of water. He was given the American Institute of Architecture Medallion for Excellence in 2007, and released his first critically acclaimed project, Faces of Water, in 2013.  Before Fame He studied cinematography and fine arts at the Avni Institute of Art and Design. He later gained a degree in architecture from the Southern California Institute of Architecture in 2006.

item.title: Wani Jikan Maulana Inyass ya na neman Gwamnan Jihar Kano a 2019
item.description: Mun ji labari cewa ‘dan takarar gwamnan jihar Kano a karkashin jam’iyyar AGA ta All Grassroots Alliance watau Shehu Tijjani Sani Auwalu Darma, yana da alaka da gidan Sheikh Shehu Ibrahim Inyass. ‘Dan takara jam’iyyar AGA a Kano jika ne wajen babban Shehin Malami Ibrahim Inyass. wanda aka fi sani da Barhama ko Gausu. Yanzu dai Tijjani Sani Auwalu Darma yana cigaba da kamfe inda yake neman jama’a su zabe sa a 2019.

item.title: 'Men Have Failed This Generation, I Hope A Woman Becomes President Of Nigeria PDP Chair
item.description: The National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Umar Damagum, shared his optimistic vision, expressing his prayer and hope that a woman will eventually rise to the presidency of Nigeria. The PDP National Chairman noted that men have let down the current generation of Nigerians. Naija News reports that Damagum, through PDP National Secretary, Samuel Anyanwu, made this statement during the party’s International Women’s Day celebration at its headquarters in Abuja.

item.title: Betty Gabriel - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress and dancer best known for playing Maling in the series Westworld and Georgina in the 2017 film Get Out. She also appeared in the 2016 film The Purge: Election Year and the 2020 mini-series Defending Jacob. Before Fame She graduated from Iowa State University with a bachelor's degree in Animal Science/Pre-Vet. Trivia She performed as a dancer and actor at theaters such as Steppenwolf and Victory Gardens. Family Life She was born in Washington D.C. and grew up in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania and Hyattsville, Maryland.

item.title: Tobey Maguire - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actor who swung to fame as the star of the 2002 film Spider-Man and was nominated for a Golden Globe Award for his role in Brothers. His roles in Seabiscuit, The Great Gatsby, and Pleasantville additionally bolstered his fame. Before Fame When he was in 6th grade, he wished to pursue a career as a chef, but his mom gave him $100 to enroll in an acting class rather than a home economics class. He appeared in The Wizard in 1989.

She has a well known Instagram as well featuring lifestyle, cheer, and more fitness-related content. Before Fame She has a background in gymnastics. item.title: Nairobi: Waiyaki Way Residents to Face Water Outages on Thursday, Friday
item.description: The Nairobi City Water and Sewerage Company Limited (NWSC) appealed to residents to use water sparinglySome of the areas that will be affected are Westlands, Highridge, Church Road and Rhapta RoadCases of acute water shortage in Nairobi have been on the increase in recent years despite heavy rainsIn May, over 10 areas in the city including State House faced water supply interruptionsWaiyaki Way residents in Nairobi county are set to face water outages on Thursday, September 9, and Friday, September 10, due to a supply line closure at the Kabete Water Treatment Plant.

item.title: Tinubu: What I Said About His 2023 Presidential Ambition
item.description: Popular lawmaker and businessman, Shina Peller has debunked reports that he spoke against the 2023 presidential ambition of Asiwaju Bola Tinubu. The lawmaker in a statement on Sunday said he was quoted out of context by some platforms saying he is against the presidential ambition of the All Progressives Congress (APC) National Leader. Peller, who represents Iseyin/Itesiwaju/ Kajola/Iwajowa federal constituency of Oyo State in the House of Representatives submitted that he only demanded a fair and just process in choosing the candidate of the party.

item.title: Emilio Estevez - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Brat Pack actor who got his start in The Breakfast Club. He acted in the cult classic film Repo Man, starred in Young Guns and played the leading role of coach Gordon Bombay in The Mighty Ducks movies. Before Fame He made short films in high school with classmate Sean Penn. Trivia He co-starred with his brother Charlie Sheen in the 1990 film Men at Work. Family Life He married singer and future American Idol judge Paula Abdul in 1992, but their relationship ended two years later.

item.title: 2023: I Do Not Bedwet, Nor Am I A Spare Tyre,
item.description: The presidential candidate of the New Nigeria Peoples Party (NNPP), Rabiu Kwankwaso has taken a veiled dig at some of his colleagues in the 2023 presidential race. Kwankwaso while describing himself as the most qualified to take over after President Muhammadu Buhari also highlighted characteristics that distinguish him from other contestants. The former Kano State Governor in a video trending on Twitter was captured saying during a radio interview programme that he is not a secondary school certificate holder or a diploma certificate holder.

item.title: Details Of Buhari's Meeting With APC Governors Emerges
item.description: The details of the meeting between President Muhammadu Buhari and  Governors elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress (APC) have emerged. Naija News earlier reported that the President met with the governors at the Presidential Villa ahead of the APC’s national convention slated for Saturday, March 26. The governors were led to the meeting by the Chairman of the Caretaker Committee of the party and the Governor of Yobe State, Mai Mala Buni.

item.title: March Horoscope | Famous Birthdays
item.description: As the short month of February comes to an end, the third month of the Gregorian calendar, March, begins. While march is one of seven months with 31 days, it is more importantly the marker of Spring's arrival. In March, the frosty coat of winter is replaced with blooming flowers and warmer temperatures. The month of March is home to many events nationally and across the globe, including St. Patrick's Day, International Women's Day and, sometimes, Easter Sunday.

item.title: Expect COVID-19 Fourth Wave In December
item.description: The Lagos State Government has asked Nigerians to expect the fourth wave of the COVID-19 pandemic in the country in December. Naija News reports that the State Commissioner for Health, Prof. Akin Abayomi, made this known at a press conference on Friday. The commissioner said as Nigerians prepare to celebrate Christmas and New Year celebrations, more passengers would come into the country from high-burden countries. Stating that the influx of passengers into the country might increase the spread of the virus and open residents to more risk.

item.description: The Narrator of 'Swamp People' Has Been in More Than 10,000 CommercialsBy Gina VaynshteynApr. 15 2021, Updated 9:50 p.m. ET Source: History ChannelIf you tune into Swamp People, the show that follows folks who live in the swamp region in Louisiana, then you're very familiar with Swamp People's narrator. item.title: Aisha Buhari To Testify Against Aminu
item.description: The First Lady of Nigeria, Aisha Buhari is set to testify against a student of the Federal University, Dutse, Jigawa State, Aminu Adamu for allegedly defaming her. Aminu in a post on his Twitter account had accused the wife of President Muhammadu Buhari of feeding on Nigeria’s money. The 24-year-old was trailed to his school and was arrested by security operatives and ever since his arrest Aminu has been in detention for nearly two weeks.

item.title: APC Fixes September For Emergency NEC Meeting
item.description: The National Working  Committee of the All Progressives Congress (APC) has fixed the first week of September for its emergency National Executive Committee (NEC) meeting. Naija News reports that the September date for the NEC meeting was chosen at the weekly NWC meeting on Wednesday at the party’s National Secretariat. It is understood that the date is subject to the approval of President Muhammadu Buhari, who is the leader of the ruling party.

item.title: Davido's Cousin, Clarks Adeleke Celebrates Chioma On 28th Birthday
item.description: The cousin of award-winning Nigerian singer, Davido, Clarks Adeleke has taken to social media to celebrate the singer’s babymama cum wife, Chioma Rowland on her 28th birthday. Naija News reports that Chioma is celebrating her 28th birthday today, April 30, 2023. Clarks Adeleke in a series of posts on his story, described Chioma as the strongest woman in the world, noting that despite everything she went through, she never gave up.

item.title: Jennifer Beals - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress best known for her starring role in Flashdance. Her performance in the film earned her an NAACP Image Award and a Golden Globe Award. She also played Bette Porter in the series The L Word.

item.title: Kelsey Cook - Age, Family, Bio

Family Life She started dating fellow stand-up comedian Kane Holloway in 2011 and has featured him on her YouTube channel.

item.description: A presidential aide, Bayo Onanuga, has reacted to the comprehensive report submitted by Jim Obazee, a special investigator appointed by President Bola Tinubu to probe the activities of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN) under former Governor Godwin Emefiele. Naija News reports that in the report, Obazee claimed that while in office as the CBN Governor, Emefiele mismanaged approximately N1.622 trillion in COVID-19 intervention funds. item.title: History of Oduduwa in Yorubaland: Read the fascinating story
item.description: Did you know there are at least 20 million Yoruba people in the 21st century? This community is ranked among the largest ethnic groups in contemporary Nigeria. The history of Oduduwa is quite fascinating. It tells the story of how the Yoruba ethnic group came to be. Oduduwa is remembered as the father and leader of the Yoruba community.

item.title: Buhari Reacts As French President Gives Fresh Appointment To Nigerian Billonaire
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron of France has appointed Kano-born billionaire businessman, Abdul Samad Rabiu, as the President of France-Nigeria Business Council (FNBC). The council is a private sector initiative to enhance business relations between the two countries. Macron appointed Rabiu, Founder/Chairman of Nigeria’s BUA Group, as the inaugural President of the council at a business summit in France. The newly inaugurated council also has Gilbert Chagoury of Chagoury Group, Mike Adenuga of Globacom and Conoil, Aliko Dangote of Dangote Industries, Tony Elumelu, Chairman UBA & Heirs Holdings, and Herbert Wigwe, CEO, Access Bank as the Nigerian members of the council.

item.title: Buhari Govt Lifts Suspension On Twitter Operations In Nigeria After 222 Days
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari has given approval for the suspension on Twitter operations in Nigeria to be lifted. The president’s directive was made public in a statement on Wednesday by the Chairman Technical Committee Nigeria-Twitter Engagement and Director-General National Information Technology Development Agency (NITDA), Kashifu Inuwa Abdullahi. According to the statement, the lifting of the suspension on Twitter operations in Nigeria will be effective from 12 am, 13th January 2022. Abdullahi explained that the approval was granted after a memo written to the President by the Minister of Communications and Digital Economy, Isa Ali Pantami.

item.description: A former Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Ahmed Makarfi, has advised Labour Party’s presidential candidate, Peter Obi; and his New Nigeria Peoples Party’s counterpart, Rabiu Kwankwaso, to return to the party. Speaking during an appearance on Channels Television on Tuesday, Makarfi urged the former governors of Anambra and Kano States respectively to swallow their personal ambition and return to the party. The former Governor of Kaduna State called on the two candidates to shelve their ambition for the sake of this country and bring positive change by pushing the All Progressives Congress (APC) out of power.

item.title: Kwara Govt To Absorb Exited Npower Batch A And B Beneficiaries Into New Scheme
item.description: The Kwara State government has declared its intention to absorb exited Npower batch A and B beneficiaries in the state into another scheme. This was disclosed on Wednesday in a statement in which the state government noted that its decision is to complement the efforts of the federal government in tackling unemployment among youths. The statement added that as a start, no fewer than 150 youths will be engaged as agents to help with the data- capturing for the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) facilitated by the Kwara State Social Investment Programmes (KWASSIP).

item.title: Chibok Girls: US Deploys Surveillance Aircraft
item.description: The United States has deployed manned surveillance aircraft over Nigeria to find more than 200 girls kidnapped from Government Girls Secondary School in Chibok, Borno by Boko Haram a month ago, Reuters reports. This information was revealed by a senior Obama administration official on Monday. "We have shared commercial satellite imagery with the Nigerians and are flying manned ISR (intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance) assets over Nigeria with the government's permission," the official said.

item.title: 'Going Through Church Is Not The Right Path'- Okowa Cautions Peter Obi
item.description: Ahead of the 2023 election, the vice presidential candidate of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP), Ifeanyi Okowa, has cautioned Labour Party (LP) flagbearer, Peter Obi, against attempting to gather votes through the church. Naija News recalls that the former Governor of Anambra state in recent times paid visits to several churches including the Dunamis International Gospel Centre, Abuja and the Redemption City of the Redeemed Christian Church of God, where he was warmly received.

item.title: BBNaija Ozo And Nengi Up For Something Special
item.description: Former housemates in the Big Brother Naija season 5 reality show, Ozo and Nengi have been spotted entering into a yet to be identified building with a third party. Reports in some quarters alleged that the Ozo was accompanying Nengi whom he had a strong affection for to check out the unidentified apartment she intends to buy. Naija News observed that the two reality show stars were seen entering the apartment with another person who is said to be the landlord of the house.

item.title: Buhari Nominates Lauretta Onochie As NDDC Board Chairman
item.description: The new media aide to President Muhammadu Buhari, Lauretta Onochie on Wednesday was appointed as the substantive chairman of the Board of the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC). President Buhari in a letter forwarded to the 9th senate led by Ahmad Lawan also announced the nomination of 15 others as NDDC board members. The President in the letter which was read in the upper chamber at plenary on Wednesday requested the Senate to confirm the nominees.

item.title: We Were Tricked To Sign Agadas Suspension Letter In Govt House Party Secretary
item.description: The All Progressives Congress (APC) secretary for Ehaje Ward 1, Sunday Innocent, has denied any role in the alleged suspension of the party’s Benue State chairman, Augustine Agada. Recall that Innocent and other party members announced Agada’s suspension due to alleged anti-party activities during the Benue general election of 2023. Naija News recalls that the party’s senatorial candidate in the recently held Benue South election, Comrade Daniel Onjeh, filed a petition against Agada, which led to the suspension.

item.title: Court Announces Secret Trial For Nnamdi Kanu, Bars Journalist
item.description: Chief Judge of the Federal High Court, Justice John Tsoho has released a new practice direction for the trial of terrorism cases before the court. The terrorism case filed against the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) is currently before the Abuja High court. The case of Bureau de change operators indicted over sponsorship of terrorism, and Boko Haram suspects are also before the court. According to Justice Tsoho, the new practice direction is in the exercise of his constitutional powers as enshrined in Section 254 of the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria 1999 (as amended).

item.description: Some Nigerians have expressed concern for May Edochie over her facial expression as she reunites with her husband, Yul over the weekend. In the video sighted online, Yul mounted the stage and placed his arm over his wife’s shoulder while telling the audience that the day is about her.

item.title: Transfer Update On Kylian Mbappe, Philips, Henderson, Onana, Toney, Lingard, Others
item.description: Real Madrid have made Mbappe a lower offer than they made during their 2022 negotiations, as reported by the Athletic. However, Mbappe may still choose to move to the Premier League, the Times claimed. Due to the expense of the loan and the 28-year-old’s wages breakdown, Juventus have withdrawn from the competition to sign Kalvin Phillips, an England and Manchester City midfield player, according to transfer expert Fabrizio Romano. Juventus have also given up on Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, 28, of Tottenham and Denmark because the transfer fee was too exorbitant, the Sun claimed.

item.title: Mali Top Group E After Humbling South Africa
item.description: South Africa started their 2023 African Cup of Nations (AFCON) campaign in the worst possible way as they suffered a massive defeat at the hands of Mali. The Bafana Bafana came into the 2023 AFCON with loads of hope of doing better than in previous editions but it seems they don’t stand a chance of winning a second AFCON title anytime soon. In their meeting with Mali at the Amadou Gon Coulibaly Stadium on January 16, they were expected to at least earn a point even if they can’t grab the entire three points.

item.title: Reverse Twitter Suspension Now PDP Govs Tells Buhari
item.description: The PDP Governors Forum has asked President Muhammadu Buhari to immediately reverse the recent suspension of Twitter’s operations in Nigeria. In a communique issued after a meeting of the Forum in Uyo, Akwa Ibom state on Monday after their meeting in Uyo, the Akwa Ibom state capital, the governors unanimously agreed that the review of the suspension would be in the interest of the country. The communique read by the Chairman of the Forum and governor of Sokoto State, Aminu Tambuwal, attacked the Buhari administration for such irrational move.

item.title: Woman Pretends to Have a Baby So She Can Sneak Snacks Into a Movie Theater in Viral TikTok
item.description: A TikToker went viral after sharing her "food baby hack" for sneaking snacks into the movies. Source: GettyIt's no secret that movie theater concession prices are astronomically high when compared to let's say a grocery store or a bodega. This has purportedly always been the case, however, and it's been a sore subject for consumers since at least 1948. Heck, there were probably some ancient Greeks grumbling about the cost of the salted chickpeas they were scarfing down as they saw a dude on stage stabbing his eyes out after learning he slept with his estranged biological mother.

Recall that Ndume had stated that the president is being ill-advised and the relocation would result in political consequences. item.description: Former Indian cricket star who is considered one of the best batsman in history and is widely known as the "God of Cricket." He recorded 100 combined ODI and Test centuries and scored more than 30,000 runs between the two formats. Before Fame He was a bully during his young years and was introduced to cricket at age 11. He debuted with India's Test side only five years later. Rowling, many supporters of the trans community have decided to boycott the game by not buying it. However, the movement has become overshadowed by the ever-climbing pre-order sales across multiple platforms for Hogwarts Legacy.

item.title: FG Declares 90 Nigerians, Foreigners Wanted
item.description: A total of 90 persons have been declared wanted by the federal government of Nigeria for violating COVID-19 travelling directives. Those declared wanted include 63 Nigerians and 27 foreigners, Naija News reports. They were declared wanted in a statement on Sunday night by the Chairman of the Presidential Steering Committee (PSC) and Secretary to the Government of the Federation (SGF), Mr Boss Mustapha. According to the statement, the travellers are from India, Brazil and Turkey and they now constitute dangers to public health.

item.title: 2023: Yoruba Nation Agitation Will Continue Even If Tinubu Succeeds Buhari
item.description: The leader of Ilana Omo Oodua, Professor Banji Akintoye, has said the agitation for the actualisation of Yoruba Nation would continue even if the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu, becomes Nigeria’s next President. In an interview with Vanguard, Akintoye said the self-determination group will not abandon its struggle for the Yoruba Nation because of the former Governor of Lagos State. He also claimed that the Yoruba may pull out of Nigeria before the 2023 general elections, saying that the majority of the people from the South West are tired of the country.

item.title: Heavy Security As Nnamdi Kanus Trial Resumes

Access to the court, adjacent to the Federal Ministry of Justice headquarters, is restricted, with entry limited to individuals on a Department of State Services (DSS) vetted list.

item.description: With the unrelenting demands of the Islamic Movement of Nigeria (IMN) popularly known as Shiites, Mr Femi Falana has once again called the Federal Government to enter into dialogue with the shites movement. Naija News Understands that the human right activist appeal came with the recent violent clash between the police and Shiites in the nation’s capital Abuja. “Since the fundamental rights of citizens to freedom of religion and freedom of expression are recognised by the Constitution of Nigeria, we urge the federal government to enter into dialogue with the Islamic Movement of Nigeria with a view to finding a lasting solution to the crisis between the Sunnis and Shiites,” he said.

Two more members of the State House of Assembly reportedly joined in the defection on Thursday, September 30, pledging their allegiance to the nation’s ruling party.

item.description: - Trump alishikilia kuwa Uchaguzi Mkuu wa 2020 ulikumbwa na wizi na bado ni mshindi - Alidokeza siku ya Jumapili, Februari 28, kwamba kuna uwezekano atagombea tena urais mwaka wa 2024 - Mwanchama huyo wa Republican mwenye miaka 74, pia alibainisha kuwa hana mpango wowote wa kubuni chama kipya Habari Nyingine: Kila unachohitaji kufahamu kuhusu familia ya Naibu Rais mpya wa Marekani, Kamala Harris Aliyekuwa Rais wa Marekani Donald Trump alidokeza siku ya Jumapili, Februari 28, kwamba kuna uwezekano atagombea tena urais mwaka wa 2024.

item.title: Dreaded Bakassi Boys Re-emerge In South East
item.description: A notorious vigilante group in the South-east, the Bakassi Boys, have reportedly re-emerged in some parts of Awka, Anambra State capital. It was gathered that the dreaded Bakassi Boys were seen in two vans, singing and warning criminals in the state. When contacted, the Police Public Relations Officer in the state, Ikenga Tochukwu, denied knowledge of the re-emergence of the vigilante group. He said, “I received this as information from you.

item.title: Get to Know Valerie Bertinelli's Son, Wolfgang Van Halen
item.description: We've seen her on our televisions for a long time, but does Valerie Bertinelli have kids? Get to know her only child, Wolfgang Van Halen. Source: Instagram / wolfiesmom ; wolfvanhalenSome celebrities have become a part of our routine as we watch them on TV each day. Watching game shows, talk shows, or cooking shows is built into so many of our daily lives, it's no surprise we start to feel like we know the hosts and guests.

item.title: What Happened to OTV's Wendy and Abe? Behind Their Split
item.description: Clear Sides Were Taken in Natsumiii and BaboAbe's DivorceRumors of cheating have dominated the discussion around the divorce of OTV's Wendy and Abe — so why did they break up? By Sara BelcherFeb. 15 2024, Published 6:46 p.m. ET Source: Instagram/@lolnatsumiii; Instagram/@baboabeMore than 60,000 people tuned into the Twitch-broadcasted wedding between streamers Wendy Luo (Natsumiii) and Abe Chung (BaboAbe), turning their intimate nuptials into a moment thousands of their followers could share with them.

item.title: Aileen Christine - Age, Family, Bio
Customer Kicked out of All-You-Can-Eat Hibachi Buffet
item.description: A woman tried to see how long she could eat at an all-you-can-eat hibachi buffet until she was asked to leave. Check out the full story. We've always wondered if restaurants really meant it when they said "all you can eat" — thankfully, we finally have our answer. Since early September 2023, TikTok creator Madison (@ugh_madison) has tried to figure out how long (and how much food) it would take before a restaurant asked her to leave.

item.title: Obaseki Congratulates Bendel Insurance For Winning Federation Cup
item.description: Governor of Edo State, Godwin Obaseki, has celebrated Bendel Insurance Football Club for winning the 2023 Federation Cup. Naija News reports that after an 18 matches unbeaten run, Bendel Insurance stunned Rangers International Football Club with a victory at the final match of the 2023 edition of the NFF Tingo Federation Cup. The match had ended 1-0 via a penalty kick converted by Imade Osarenkhoe. Commenting on the finals of the Federation Cup played in Asaba, Delta State, Governor Obaseki, in a statement issued on Thursday morning, said: “I heartily congratulate Bendel Insurance Football Club for an impressive season run which culminated in the lifting of the Federation Cup trophy after defeating Rangers International Football Club in Asaba, Delta.

item.title: Polisi Baringo wadaiwa kumuua mtaalamu wa kushika nge wenye sumu
item.description: - Wakaaji walisema, polisi walidai kumkamata David Owino kwa kunywa pombe haramu ingawa wakaaji waliuliza ni kwa nini alipigwa hadi kufa - Owino alidaiwa kuwa na uwezo wa kushika kwa mkono nge hatari na wenye sumu pia alikuwa akiwalisha mamba katika makazi yao - Owino alikuwa pia ni mwongozaji watalii katika Ziwa Baringo Wakaaji wa Baringo wameghadhabishwa na tukio la kuuawa kwa jamaa anayedaiwa kuwa na uwezo wa pekee wa kushika kwa mikono nge wenye sumu na kulisha mamba.

item.title: Why Does Olivia Rodrigo Credit Paramore on "Sour"? Plus, Her Net Worth
item.description: Olivia Rodrigo has seen a ton of success with her music and acting career. But what is her net worth? And why does she credit Paramore on "Sour"? Source: Getty ImagesSinger and actress Olivia Rodrigo seems to be everywhere lately. Her album "Sour" was streamed tons of times and fans love her acting. Besides, we're all still waiting for the third season of High School Musical: The Musical: The Series. With all this success, we're all wondering what her net worth is.

item.title: Daniela Denby-ashe - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: English actress best known for playing Sarah Hills on the series EastEnders from 1995 to 1999. She has also been in Office Gossip and Midsomer Murders. Before Fame She began studying ballet when she was two and attended several acting schools between the ages of ten and sixteen. Trivia In 2012, she was cast as Lorraine Donnegan on the popular BBC drama series Waterloo Road. Family Life Her family was of Polish descent and she, herself, became fluent in Polish and French.

item.title: Joe Perry - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Lead guitarist of the power rock band Aerosmith, the group known for songs like "I Don't Wanna Miss a Thing." He was a Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductee in 2001. Before Fame He studied at a boarding school in Vermont. His first group was called The Jam Band. Trivia He was ranked 48th on Rolling Stone's list of the 100 Greatest Guitarists of All Time. Family Life He married Elyssa Jerret on August 5, 1975, and, after their divorce in 1985, he married Billie Paulette Montgomery on September 21, 1985.

item.title: Kate Mara - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Actress who played Zoe Barnes on the Netflix series House of Cards. She has also played prominent roles in the films Fantastic Four, Brokeback Mountain, Shooter, The Open Road, Transcendence, and The Martian. In 2018, she began starring in FX's Pose. Before Fame She was accepted into the elite New York University Tisch School of the Arts, but had to delay starting for three years because she was already so busy with acting. Trivia She appeared as Shari Rothenberg in five episodes of the FOX series 24 in 2006 and also played the character Brittany in four episodes of HBO's Entourage in 2009.

item.title: Thunderstorm Kills Three Anambra Pupils On Football Field
item.description: Three male students in Okpuno, Awka South Local Government Area of Anambra State, have lost their lives while playing football on the school field. Naija News learnt that the incident happened late Saturday during rainfall which was accompanied by breeze and thunderstorms. An eyewitness who spoke with Punch revealed that the students were practising on the school’s pitch in preparation for a football competition before the lightning started. The eyewitness said about nine students were involved while six of them were resuscitated later at the school’s clinic where they were first rushed to.

item.title: WARNING: Six trucks burning on Benin-Ore expressway - FRSC
item.description: Six trucks have caught fire at Kilometre 33 of the Benin-Ore Expressway on Monday afternoon, the Federal Road Safety Corps (FRSC) has reported. The expressway is blocked. The cause of the crash is not yet known but. The FRSC has said in a message that road users inbound from Lagos should make a detour at Ogbemudia Farms. Should you be a witness of the event or possess any additional information or photos from the site, please help us to provide the fresh updates.

item.title: APC Will Tap From Buhari's Wisdom To Zone 2023 Elections
item.description: Ogun State Governor, Dapo Abiodun has disclosed that the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) will soon reveal details of the zoning formula it will use in choosing candidates that will represent the party in the 2023 elections. The Governor explained on Friday that the leadership of the party is working on the zoning formula to be used which will then be presented to the National Executive Council of the party (NEC) for approval

item.title: Excitement In Kano As Ahmed Musa Slashes Fuel Price At His Petrol Station
item.description: Super Eagles’ captain, Ahmed Musa, has slashed the price of petrol per litre at his filling station in Kano. Naija News reports that the 30-year-old professional footballer announced the reduction of the price of Premium Motor Spirit (PMS) via his Twitter page on Monday. Musa revealed that the product is sold at N580 at MYCA7, his petrol station in Kano, against the N620 per litre price in the state. “Fuel #580 @MYCA -7 Filling Station Kano,” Musa wrote on his verified Twitted page.

item.title: MadeinTYO - Age, Family, Bio
item.description: Rapper known for his February 2016 single "Uber Everywhere," which approached the top 50 of the Billboard Hot 100. He released his debut EP, You Are Forgiven, later that same year. Before Fame He grew up traveling in a military family. His inspiration to rap came from his cousin. Trivia He recorded the song "Uber Everywhere" in his kitchen. His stage name stands for Made in Tokyo. Family Life He was born Malcolm Jamaal Davis in Honolulu, Hawaii and spent six years in Tokyo, Japan.

item.title: Taylor Swift Confirms "Cruel Summer" Will Become a Single When Is the Release Date?
item.description: Taylor Swift announced that the song "Cruel Summer" off her 2019 album "Lover" will now be a single. Here's when you expect the track to transition. Source: Getty ImagesAsk a Swiftie for an adjective to describe summer and they'll likely tell you cruel after the Taylor Swift song of the same name. The song was off Taylor’s album “Lover” which was released in 2019. It instantly became a fan favorite, so much so that in 2023, it continued to land on top music charts like Billboard's Hot 100.

item.title: DSS Allegedly Extends Secret Raid To CCB, ICPC, Cart Away Files
item.description: The Department of State Services (DSS) has allegedly carted away sensitive files from the Code of Conduct Bureau (CCB) and the Independent Corrupt Practices and Other Related Offences Commission ( ICPC). Naija News recalls that SaharaReporters on Tuesday, June 13 2023 reported that the DSS secretly raided the offices of the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) in Abuja and Lagos. The DSS operatives during the raid, according to inside sources, carted away files and flash drives containing sensitive information about former governors, ministers and senators under investigation.

item.title: Features of 1999 constitution in Nigeria
item.description: The latest constitution of Nigeria that was created to rule our country was accepted in 1999. This document became the fourth in Nigerian history to appear in the law field. However, there is a huge history before that constitution and its power. A lot of things have been changed, modified or even disappeared from the life and laws of Nigerians. It is easy to see how, throughout the years, Nigeria is developing its legal system, bringing new political, economic and social opportunities for the people.

She has also done modeling work, and is signed with Option 1 Models in Chicago. Before Fame She launched her YouTube channel in January 2011. Trivia She has also gained popularity on her haileylainee TikTok account for her lip sync videos. item.title: Im Not A Saint, Equally Not A Thief
item.description: The 2023 presidential candidate for the Labour Party (LP), Peter Obi, has said he is not a saint but has never stolen any money from the coffers of the government. Naija News reports that the former Governor of Anambra State made this known on Saturday during the #PeterObiOnParallelFacts Twitter Space forum organised by The Parallel Facts. The LP flagbearer said he left the funds he saved as the Anambra governor and also invested state funds properly, adding that state funds should be used for the public good, not for personal good.

item.title: 'COVID-19 To Last Seven Years'
item.description: Popular cleric and founder of the God’s Temple Church (GTC), London, United Kingdom, Pastor Peterside Iyun, has released some prophecies for the year 2022. According to the clergyman, the COVID-19 pandemic which started in late 2019, “will last for period of seven years”. He however revealed that there would be major scientific breakthroughs this new year. While revealing that many will cheat death, Pastor Iyun claimed that “strange winds, storms and volcanos” will hit parts of the world.

item.title: Celebrities Rent Money To Show Off On Social Media
item.description: Nollywood actress,Tonto Dikeh has taken to social media to expose some of her colleagues who live fake lives on social media. The mother of one via her Instagram page advised her fans not be intimidated by the wealth and lifestyle flaunted by many celebrities on social media, revealing it’s all fake. According to the actress cum philanthropist, many celebrities rent money from Bureau the change and bankers to show off on social media and post their friend’s cars as theirs.

item.title: David Brewster - Trivia, Family, Bio
item.description: Pioneering physicist remembered for his work in the field of optics. He was a keen inventor, having invented notable devices such as the kaleidoscope and the binocular camera. Before Fame He was a Christian minister but only preached from the pulpit once. Trivia He was one of the foremost writers to contribute to the famed Encycloaedia Britannica. Family Life He was married twice and had five children, including a daughter and four sons.

item.title: New Zamfara Deputy Gov Nasiha Resigns From Senate
item.description: The new deputy Governor of Zamfara State, Muhammad Nasiha has officially resigned as the lawmaker representing Zamfara Central Senatorial District. This is coming after the state Governor, Bello Matawalle appointed Nasiha as his deputy. Nasiha replaced Mahadi Ali, who was impeached last week by the Zamfara State House of Assembly. The Senate President, Ahmed Lawan while reading a letter addressed to the Senate at the plenary, announced Nasiha’s resignation to the Senate.

item.title: Wife And Husband's Instagram Photos Go Viral And Spark Body Image Debate
item.description: Wife And Husband's Instagram Photos Go Viral And Spark Body Image DebateBy Mark PygasUpdated Nov. 18 2019, 2:17 p.m. ET Jasmine Owens is a 25-year-old student and mother of two from Honolulu who recently took to Instagram to share a vacation photo of her and her husband. A caption alongside the photo includes an inspirational note about learning to love her body as it is, and the message is going viral.

item.title: Is Jacob Blake Alive? He Was Shot in the Back Multiple Times
item.description: What Happened to Jacob Blake? He Was Shot Multiple TimesBy Shannon RaphaelUpdated Aug. 24 2020, 12:06 p.m. ET Source: TwitterThe name Jacob Blake has been trending online, as the 29-year-old was seriously injured after getting shot seven times in the back in Kenosha, Wis. A partial video of the incident, which occurred in broad daylight, has been making the rounds online. The shooting of Jacob Blake has sparked further protests against police brutality, and it has many members of the public calling for the police officers involved to be arrested.

item.description: Ahmad Salkida, the only Nigerian journalist/civilian to have access to Boko Haram was reportedly flown in a few weeks back by the Nigerian government to act as negotiator between them and the Boko Haram extremists. Ahmad Salkilda Salkida, who previously worked for Daily Trust and Premium Times and reported extensively on Boko Haram had fled Nigeria to Dubai about 2 years ago, after he was being accused of being a Boko Haram sympathizer.

item.title: Famous Television Locations in Paris
item.description: Relive Your Favorite TV Shows on Your Next Vacation to ParisBy Jamie LernerPublished July 18 2022, 10:29 a.m. ET Source: NetflixSome of our all-time favorite television shows have been filmed all over the world. Not only do we want to go to Paris, but how cool would it be to see some of the actual filming locations from some of our favorite television shows?

item.title: Parents Should Beg ASUU To End Strike
item.description: Presidential spokesman, Garba Shehu, has asked parents to beg the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) to end their strike so that the nation’s public universities can be re-opened. Shehu also condemned the recent extension of the strike by four weeks, saying that the government is trying to meet some of the demands given by the lecturers. According to Shehu, the extension of the industrial action came at a time the president is giving full commitment to resolving the ASUU strike.

item.title: Police Send Stern Warning To Christians On Some Of The Prayers They Organise
item.description: The Ogun state police has sent a stern warning to Christian’s that conduct prayers inside the forest. The police warned against this because of the possibility of getting kidnapped during a prayer session in the forest. They said that despite their constant warning to desist from such acts some Christians still continued with the prayers. In a statement released by the Ogun state Police Public Relation Officer, Abimbola Oyeyemi said that though there was freedom of religion but the warning should be taken seriously for security purposes.

item.title: 2023: I Will Only Contest Alongside Amaechi If Buhari Insists
item.description: The Governor of Kaduna State, Nasir El-Rufai on Wednesday revealed what will make him run in the 2023 presidential election. El-Rufai while speaking on the general elections said he would only contest as a presidential aspirant or a running mate to the Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi if President Muhammadu Buhari insists. The Kaduna State Governor, however, stated that he has no intention to contest in the presidential election. El-Rufai disclosed this while speaking on Channels TV on Wednesday.

item.title: Edo: You Can't Force COVID-19 Vaccination On People
item.description: A federal high court sitting in Port Harcourt, the Rivers State capital has disagreed with Governor Godwin Obaseki on his decision to ban residents of the state who are yet to be vaccinated from entering public places. The Court in its ruling on Tuesday in a suit with reference number: FHC/PH/FHR/266/2021 filed by Charles Osaretin told the Governor to stay action until some matters are settled. Naija News recalls Obaseki had declared that starting from the second week of September, people in the state will be required to show their COVID-19 vaccination cards before gaining access to public spaces.

item.title: FG Lists Condition For Ban On Twitter To Be Lifted
item.description: The Minister of Information and Culture, Lai Mohammed, Wednesday disclosed that microblogging platform, Twitter is set to engage with the Federal Government. Recall that the Federal Government suspended the operations of the Twitter in Nigeria last Friday. The Minister while speaking with State House correspondents after the weekly Federal Executive Council (FEC), noted that the social media platform had reached out to the government seeking high-level discussion to resolve the issue.

item.title: Marianne Kitany's mother recounts she asked Linturi if he loved her daughter or her money
item.description: - Rodah Chepkoech said Linturi affirmed his love for Marianne during a dowry payment function held at her home in Nandi - She revealed the two families enjoyed cordial relationships until late 2016 when her daughter started complaining about the senator's attempt to snatch her property - The couple is embroiled in a nasty divorce case which has captured the attention of the public thanks to the shocking testimonies from witnesses

item.title: You Are Not Abacha Or Buhari, Let Nnamdi Kanu Go
item.description: The Special Counsel to the leader of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, Aloy Ejimakor has urged President Bola Tinubu not to toe the line of late Military Head of State, Sani Abacha and former President Muhammadu Buhari over their stance on self-determination. He pleaded with the President to set the agitator free, adding that failure to do so would backfire. Ejimakor sent the warning via a series of tweets.

item.title: Breakdown showing how boys performed better than girls in KCSE 2017
item.description: - A keen breakdown of the just released KCSE results indicate that boys performed better than girls from an overall perspective - Despite the female students dominating the top slots nationally, boys generally outshone them in by more numbers attaining University-worthy grades Boys dominated the charts in the just released 2017 KCSE examination results, despite the top student being a girl, TUKO.co.ke has established. Education Cabinet Secretary Fred Matiang’i on Wednesday, December 20 had announced that the ladies had registered better performances than the male students across the six major subjects.

When a show gets really popular, it can get a bunch of spinoffs from all over the world — which is exactly what happened with Married At First Sight.

item.title: Nigerian Troops Kill Over 37 Boko Haram Terrorists In Borno
item.description: Troops of the Nigerian Army have killed scores of the Islamic State West Africa (ISWAP) members and Boko Haram terrorists in Sambisa Forest in Borno State. In a statement on Sunday by the Army spokesperson, Brigadier General Onyema Nwachukwu, the insurgents were killed during a gun duel with troops of Operation Hadin Kai, Nigeria’s counter-terrorism operation in the North-East. Nwachukwu stated that over 37 Boko Haram/ISWAP terrorists were neutralized, while several of them reportedly suffered varying degrees of injury.

item.title: PDP Crisis: Ayu To Resign After 2023 Elections
item.description: The Board of Trustees (BoT) of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has today disclosed that the party’s National Chairman, Iyorchia Ayu, would resign after the forthcoming general elections. The BoT has however asked Ayu to give firm commitment that he will resign after the general election next year. According to the PDP BoT Chairman, Adolphus Wabara, he said the Sokoto State Governor, Aminu Tambuwal, who is also the Chairman of the PDP Governors Forum, was called upon to summon an emergency meeting.

item.title: 10 best rehabilitation centres in Nigeria and their location
item.description: There are numerous rehabilitation centres in Nigeria created to alleviate the prevalent issue of substance abuse. These centres play a key role in rehabilitating addicts and substance abusers, creating awareness amongst community members, and developing solutions to combat the substance abuse menace in the country. Like other institutions, these centres vary greatly in their services, costs, and target clients. Substance abuse is a major challenge in many countries, making it necessary to have places and professionals dealing with those looking to escape the vice.

item.title: Mwizi aomba afisa wa polisi uelekezi baada ya kuiba gari

item.title: Private Sector Loan Borrowing From Commercial Banks Hit N36.7trn CBN
item.description: The Central Bank of Nigeria, CBN, has revealed that private sectors in the country borrowed not less than N5.1 trillion from commercial banks in the year 2021. The apex bank in its Money and Credit statistics published on its official website noted that total credit to the private sector now stands at N36.7 trillion. On a year-on-year basis, credit to the private sector rose by N5.6 trillion, from N30.1tn recorded in December 2020 to N35.

item.title: Buhari Returns To Abuja After World Bio Summit In South Korea
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari returned to Abuja on Friday morning after attending the first edition of the World Bio Summit in Seoul, the capital of South Korea. President Buhari, who arrived at the Presidential Wing of the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport, Abuja, at about 6am, was received by two governors, senior government officials and security chiefs. Among those at the airport to receive the President were the Governors of Katsina and Niger States; Aminu Bello Masari and Abubakar Sani Bello respectively; the Minister of the Federal Capital Territory (FCT), Mohammed Musa Bello, and the Chief of Staff to the President, Professor Ibrahim Gambari.

In fact, the level of corruption makes the PDP governments look like angels because corruption is now a thousand times worse.

item.title: Tinubu Should Study Igbos Apprenticeship System If He Wants To Change Nigeria's Economy
item.description: Former presidential aide, Reno Omokri has urged President Bola Tinubu to study the Igbo apprenticeship system if he wishes to turn the economy in the country around. He opined that how Igbo people learn trades and reinvent themselves as capitalists should be analysed. Omokri stated this via a Twitter post on Saturday. According to him, the Igbos apprenticeship in the informal business sector can be used to tackle unemployment in the country.

item.title: Scare as Tanzania airplane suffers multiple bird strikes while landing
item.description: - The plane encountered the birds and during impact, blood was splattered on its windscreens leaving the pilots with impaired vision - The birds also got lodged in the plane's engine vents, landing gear compartments and also hit important equipment that control air speed - Nobody was hurt as pilots managed to maneuver the plane safely to Mwanza Airport though at a precarious state Passengers traveling aboard a Tanzanian plane on the morning of Sunday, December 9, escaped death by a whisker after their aircraft flew into a flock of birds.

item.title: PDP Reps Move To Impeach President Buhari Over Insecurity
item.description: The Peoples Democratic Party, PDP, has called for the impeachment of Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari over the spate of insecurity in the country. item.title: Okorocha Survives Assassination Attempt, Police Officer Killed
item.description: Former Imo State Governor, Rochas Okorocha has narrated how he survived an assassination attempt when his convoy was attacked by gunmen in the Ihube community on the Okigwe- Enugu expressway. One of the policemen in the convoy was however not lucky as he lost his life in the attack. Confirming the attack, Okorocha who spoke on Sunday narrated that the cop killed during the attack which happened on Friday was one of the policemen deployed from the state Government House to take him to the burial ceremony of the mother of the immediate past governor of Imo state, Emeka Ihedioha.

item.title: 'Tinubu Cannot Be Trusted' - Says PDP Chieftain, Shehu Mahdi
item.description: A supporter of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) and rights activist, Shehu Mahdi, has said that the presidential candidate of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu cannot be trusted. Naija News understands that Mahdi said this in reaction to Tinubu’s address during the inauguration of members for the women’s presidential campaign team chaired by his wife, Oluremi Tinubu. Speaking at the event that was held in Abuja earlier this week, Tinubu said: “Assurance is here, the promise is here, prosperity is here, health is here, security is here, banditry has ended”.

item.title: Catholic Diocese Of Enugu Lifts Ban On Mbakas Adoration Ministry
item.description: The Catholic Diocese of Enugu on Thursday lifted the ban on the Adoration ministry of Rev Fr Ejike Mbaka. Recall that the Catholic Bishop of Enugu Diocese, Bishop Calistus Onaga banned the Catholic faithful from attending the Ministry following Mbaka’s comment against the presidential candidate of the Labour Party, Peter Obi. Mbaka had during his mid-week prayer activities described Obi as a stingy man, adding that he can not be Nigeria’s president.

item.title: Boko Haram Acquire Military Grade Ammunition
item.description: The share volume of ammunition available to Boko Haram now forces most analyst to conclude that Nigeria is engaged in a full scale war of survival. Extremist attack casualties are expected to rise as fighters now have access to sophisticated weaponry. While Nigeria's military has fought in the past decade with heavily armed militants and criminal gangs operating in the creeks of its oil-rich southern delta, analysts and security official say those groups never had access to anti-aircraft weapons nor did these groups launch attacks overrunning military barracks or levelling towns.

item.title: Good News, 'Schitt's Creek' Fans: We Get One More Season of the Roses
Ibadan Mother Claims Her Baby Born With Quran In His Hand
item.description: An Islamic preacher in Ibadan, Oyo State, Dr Dawood Amoo, has described the birth of a baby boy holding a pocket-size Qur’an in his hand. Amoo told journalists that the boy was unique, because mini Qur’an contained all the 114 chapters in the holy book. The baby’s mother went to deliver him at a church because she feared of hospital bills. The woman who took the boy saw the ‘strange’ object and threw it away as something devilish, but soon the baby became restless and continued to clutch and empty fist.

item.title: Orubebe Dumps PDP, Submits Resignation Letter
item.description: Former Niger Delta Affairs Minister, Godsday Orubebe, has resigned from the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) with immediate effect. Recall that Orubebe came into prominence in 2015 when he attempted to scuttle the collation of results of the presidential election at the International Conference Centre (ICC), Abuja. Orubebe, who was the PDP agent for the election, accused the then chairman of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC), Professor Attahiru Jega, of bias against his party.

item.title: How Security Operatives Foiled Edo Jailbreak Correctional Service
item.description: The Nigerian Correctional Service (NCoS), Edo State Command, has revealed how security operatives foiled an attempted jailbreak by inmates at its facility in Ubiaja. A statement on Friday by the state Public Relations Officer, Aminu Suleman, said that the incident occurred on Wednesday following a riot after the inmates refused to return to their cells. He disclosed that inmates attempted the jailbreak after they heard about the incidents at the correctional facilities in Oko and Benin in Edo, as well as the recent attack on the custodial centre in Owerri, the Imo State capital.

Fresh Update Emerges On Price Of Refilling Cooking Gas In Nigeria
item.description: The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) has released a report stating that the average retail price for refilling a 5kg cylinder of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (cooking gas) has increased. In its latest data update, the government agency noted that in January 2024, the price of refilling cooking gas rose by 3.55% compared to December 2023, reaching ₦5,139.25. According to NBS, on a year-on-year basis, the price increased by 12.00% from ₦4,588.

item.title: PDP Holds Emergency Meeting, May Postpone Presidential Primaries
item.description: The National Working Committee (NWC) of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) has called an emergency meeting to discuss the possible postponement of its convention scheduled for today, Saturday. It was gathered that the main agenda of the meeting is the decision of the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) to extend deadline for conclusion of party primaries. Recall that the electoral body had on Friday evening extended the deadline for parties to conduct their primaries, shifting their deadline from June 3 to June 9.

item.title: Top Nasarawa Traditional Ruler Is Dead
item.description: The Aren Eggon and paramount ruler of Eggon in Nasarawa State, Bala Angbazo has been confirmed dead. The death of the top traditional ruler was confirmed to newsmen on Wednesday by James Angbazo, the Dangaladima Eggon. Angbazo stated that the Eggon paramount ruler pass away earlier on Wednesday morning at the age of 89 after a long illness. The late Bala Angbazo was born in Wakama District, Nassarawa-Eggon Local Government Area of the state in 1933.

item.title: Nnamdi Kanu Remanded In DSS Custody, Trial Resumption To Begin July 26
item.description: The Federal High Court in Abuja has remanded the leader of the proscribed Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB), Nnamdi Kanu, in the custody of the Department of State Services (DSS). In a short ruling on Tuesday, the trial judge, Justice Binta Nyako ordered that Kanu be remanded based on an application that was brought by the Federal Government. Justice Nyako ordered that Kanu should remain in custody till July 26 pending the resumption of his trial.

item.title: Atiku Not Fit, Too Old To Become President Bauchi Gov
item.description: Governor Bala Mohammed of Bauchi State has said he told former Vice President Atiku Abubakar not to contest the 2023 presidential race. Naija News reports that Mohammed made the submission on Friday when a Contact and Consultation Committee he set up for his presidential ambition submitted its report to him. The Bauchi governor said Atiku is too old and tired to lead the country, asking the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) chieftain to support his ambition to become President in 2023.

item.title: Deji Adeyanju Calls For Obi, Kwankwaso Presidential Ticket Against APC, PDP
item.description: The convener of the Concerned Nigerian movement and human rights activist, Deji Adeyanju has called for a presidential ticket of former Governor of Anambra State as the presidential candidate, while the leader of the New Nigeria Peoples Party, Musa Kwankwaso stands as his running mate. Adeyanju in a post on his Twitter account said he would prefer Obi as President to defeat the Peoples Democratic Party and the All Progressives Congress in the 2023 general election.

Her first picture on Instagram was posted in October of 2013.

item.title: 'All Senators Received N2 Million'- Ndume Blames Akpabio For Creating A Wrong Impression
item.description: The Senate Chief Whip, Ali Ndume, has blamed Senate President Godswill Akpabio for the ongoing controversy surrounding the holiday allowance of senators. Naija News recalls that last week Monday, before the senate went on recess, the president of the senate said the Senate clerk sent a token to the lawmakers to enable them to “enjoy their holidays.” A comment he later withdrew to say he was sending prayers into the mail boxes of all senators for the holiday.

item.title: Bandit Terrorists Kidnap Zamfara Speakers Father, Step mother
item.description: Bandit terrorists have abducted the father and step-mother of the Speaker of the Zamfara State Assembly, Alhaji Nasiru Muazu Magarya. Naija News understand that the gunmen stormed Magarya community of Zurmi Local Government Area of the state on Tuesday night, shooting sporadically to the air. It was learned that the gunmen abducted the speaker’s uncle and four other persons during the attack. As of the time of filing this report, the state Police Command is yet to issue a statement on the matter.

item.title: BBNaija Housemate Reveals He Paid N3.1million To Board Private Jet From Abuja To Lagos
item.description: The 2020 Big Brother Naija reality show is getting more interesting after one of the housemates, Kiddwaya disclosed that he paid $8000 to board a private jet from Abuja to Lagos for the show. In a now-viral video on the microblogging site, the housemate while interacting with his fellow contestants said he spent the said amount to meet up with the official screening of the reality show. Kiddwaya further revealed to Wathoni, Tolanibaj, and Nengi during the chat that the President of Madagascar, Andry Rajoelina, is a friend to his father.

item.title: Number Of Students Kidnapped By Bandits In Fresh Kaduna School Attack Revealed
item.description: A total of 287 students from the LEA Primary and Secondary School in Kuriga, Kaduna State, were kidnapped on Thursday when bandits attacked the school premises. This was made known in an update given by the Head Teacher, Sani Abdullahi, who narrated the incident when Governor Uba Sani led senior government officials and security top brass to the Kuriga Village Head’s palace. As earlier reported by Naija News, bandits struck at the LEA school, triggering chaos and the abduction of numerous individuals, including the school’s head teacher and several other staff members.

item.title: Reactions As Angry Fans Demand Refund After Kizz Daniel Stood Them Up For Over 4 Hours At His Concer
item.description: Nigerian award-winning singer Oluwatobiloba Daniel Anidugbe popularly called Kizz Daniel is currently trending on Twitter after showing up late at his concert in the USA. In the videos which have gone viral, angry fans were heard shouting, booing and demanding a refund from the singer. According to the fans who had attended the concert which took place on Thursday, 7th July 2022, Kizz Daniels who is touring ten cities in the US was four hours late for his show and only performed for a few minutes.

Anxiety Grips Enugu College Of Education Following Dismissal Of 95 Employees
item.description: The Enugu State College of Education Technical, ESCET, has terminated the employment of no fewer than 95 staff members. Naija News learnt that the College’s Registrar, Pat Aneke, conveyed the news of the development to the affected staff on Tuesday. An attendee of the meeting reported that the layoff was ascribed to claimed irregularities in the engagement of the employees with a tenure of three years. An anonymous worker according to Daily Post, reported high tension at their institution following the dismissal of 95 staff members, both academic and non-academic, hired in 2021.

item.title: Buhari Returns To Nigeria After Medical Vacation
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari on Friday night arrived in the country after a two-week trip to the United Kingdom. Naija News reports that the president’s aircraft landed at the Presidential Wing of the Nnamdi Azikiwe International Airport at about 18:45 pm on Friday. The President travelled to attend the Global Partnership for Education (GPE) organised Global Education Summit (GES) before undergoing a scheduled medical check-up. Buhari had on Thursday paid a visit to the National Chairman of the All Progress Congress (APC), Bola Tinubu.

item.description: Olusegun Bamgbose, Esq., National Coordinator, Concerned Advocates for Good Governance (CAGG) has berated a former Speaker of the House of Representatives, Yakubu Dogara, following his return to the All Progressives Congress (APC). Naija News recalls that Yakubu Dogara had on Friday dumped the opposition Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) for the APC. The Chairman of the APC Caretaker/Convention Planning Committee and Governor of Kebbi State, Mai Malla Buni, disclosed this after the duo met with President Muhammadu Buhari at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.

item.title: Four Key Atletico Madrid Players To Miss Man United Clash
item.description: Atletico Madrid will be without four key players in their Champions League match against Manchester United on Wednesday (today). The Spanish professional football club will host the Premier League side in round of 16 first-leg tie today at the Wanda Metropolitano Stadium, Naija News reports. The four players reportedly ruled out in the clash are Koke, Yannick Carrasco, Matheus Cunha and Daniel Wass. Koke joins Matheus Cunha and Daniel Wass on Atletico Madrid’s injury list, while Carrasco will miss both legs of the tie through suspension.

item.title: Put On Your Trekking Shoes As Fuel Price Soars
item.description: Renowned Nollywood actress, Hilda Dokubo has urged Nigerians to brace themselves for a significant shift in their daily lives, highlighting the need for endurance in the face of escalating economic difficulties. Through a video message disseminated on her Instagram platform on Thursday, Dokubo painted a vivid picture of a future marked by austerity, suggesting that the populace should prepare for “a new lifestyle of long fasting, long trekking, and long-suffering.”

item.title: Barcelona Board Members Want Messi To Leave
item.description: Some member of the Barcelona board want the club captain, Lionel Messi, to leave the club during the summer transfer window. According to ESPN, some are hoping to persuade the Argentine to stay, others would not mind disposing the forward. There were reports that Messi met with the club new manager, Ronald Koeman, and noted that he sees himself more out than in at Camp Nou. The Barcelona manager is keen to keep the player and build his team around him.

item.title: Shot Pakistan Schoolgirl Malala Yousafzai Addresses UN
item.description: Malala Yousafzai, the Pakistani girl shot by the Taliban, has told the United Nations that books and pens scare extremists, as she urged education for all. Speaking on her 16th birthday, Malala said efforts to silence her had failed. She was shot in the head on a school bus by Taliban gunmen because of her campaign for girls' rights. The speech at the UN headquarters in New York was her first public address since last October's incident in Pakistan's north-western Swat valley.

item.title: Sea Pirates Kill Oil Workers, Civil Defence Personnel In Bayelsa
item.description: Gunmen suspected to be sea pirates have launched multiple attacks on some workers with the Nigerian Agip Oil Company (NAOC). Naija News gathered that the attack which occurred early Sunday morning took place on Okoroma and Ogbokiri–Akassa communities of Nembe and Brass local government areas of Bayelsa State. The pirates reportedly killed two workers of the Nigerian Agip Oil Company and an operative of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps (NSCDC).

item.title: Emeka Rollas Re-elected As AGN President
item.description: The Actors Guild of Nigeria (AGN) has conducted a fresh election ushering in Ejezie Emeka Rollas for a second tenure as its National President for the next three years. According to reports, the new leadership was re-elected on Tuesday at the end of the 2022 Nollywood Actor Summit of the guild held in Benin City, Edo. Emeka polled 115 affirmative votes from about 120 delegates from 20 states against four nays to retain his position just as Abubakar Yakubu Salisu got 120 ‘yes’ votes against one nay vote to return as National Secretary.

item.title: November 5 Horoscope and Zodiac
item.description: As a Scorpio born on November 5th, your artistic talents are matched with a shy and determined personality. item.title: Burnley Trashes Liverpool Home Unbeaten Record With 0-1 Win
item.description: English Premier League defending champions, Liverpool FC’s home unbeaten record has been broken. Burnley FC on Thursday night, January 21, defeated the Reds with a 0-1 win at Anfield to deprive the reds of another three points in the English league. Naija News understands that Liverpool has last lost a match at Anfield since April 23, 2017. The Reds last suffered a league defeat on home soil since a 2-1 loss against Crystal Palace when Christian Benteke grabbed both goals against his former club.

item.title: University of Nairobi: courses, admissions and fees
item.description: The University of Nairobi founded under cap 210 Act of Parliament is the forerunner institution of university education in Kenya and its environs. The University of Nairobi offers approximately over two hundred courses presently. Court Orders AGF To Prosecute Former Imo Governor Over Nude Photos Of A Businesswoman
item.description: A Federal High Court in Abuja presided over on Monday by Justice Taiwo Taiwo has ruled that former Imo Governor, Ikedi Ohakim has a case to answer over alleged threats to release nude photos of a businesswoman. This follows the attempt by the Nigeria Police Force to discontinue the case against the former Governor but which was rejected by Justice Taiwo. The Judge held that the matter has become a criminal matter and the Attorney-General of the Federation (AGF) and Minister of Justice should take over the prosecution.

item.title: Look Inside Judy Garlands Bel-Air Home That Sold for $11 Million

item.title: Nigerian Female Billionaire, Folorunsho Alakija, Defeats Oprah Winfrey To Become Richest Black Woman
item.description: Move over Oprah, Nigerian oil tycoon Folorunsho Alakija is now the richest black woman in the world with an estimated fortune of $7.3 billion. Africa boasts of 55 billionaires - far more than previously thought - and they're worth a staggering $143.88 billion in total, according to pan-African magazine Ventures Africa. Starting her career as a secretary in a bank in the mid 1970s, Alakija, 62, then studied fashion in London and returned to Nigeria to start a label, Supreme Stitches.

item.title: Woman Pours Hot Cooking Oil On Her Husband Over Alleged Infidelity
item.description: Police has launched a manhunt for the 32-year-old Zambia woman who is on the run after allegedly pouring hot cooking oil on her husband. According to reports, the suspect identified as Elizabeth Mweete poured hot oil on her husband, Mr Alex Muleya,39 on Tuesday, December 28 in House number 116 Kuku Compound in Zambia where the couple lived. It was gathered that the wife poured hot oil on her husband after overhearing his phone conversation with an unknown caller whom she thought the man was having an affair with.

item.title: 'LP/NNPP Merger Threatened Over INEC Regulations'

He had said: “We are in talks with Peter Obi and a committee is working to look into how to form a merger between us.

item.title: 25 famous Frederick Douglass quotes on education, power and slavery
item.description: Frederick Douglass is a man whose legacy will still be honoured centuries to come. The abolitionist leader was born into slavery in the 1800s, but this did not narrow his vision. He is known as one of the early champions of women's rights, and this is why Frederick Douglass quotes are still popular decades after his demise. Frederick Augustus Washington Bailey was the first African American nominated for vice president of the United States, but this is just one of his many achievements.

item.title: As The ASUU Strike Lingers
item.description: Most students in public universities across the country would not forget July 1, 2013 in a hurry. It was the date the Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) commenced the ongoing industrial action. What was thought to be a “mere police action” that would be addressed in days has now lingered for close to three months. It has taken the backstage as the concern of the polity is the crisis rocking the People’s Democratic Party (PDP) which is far in our “national interest” than the ramblings of a couple of bearded professors and lecturers who know next to nothing about ‘the delicate art of governance’.

item.title: Barbie Premiere: BBNaija Diane, 6 Other Stars Turn Up for Event in Dazzling Ensembles
item.description: Glamour, glitz, and all things Barbie came to life as the highly-anticipated Lagos Barbie premiere took center stage on Thursday evening of July 21, 2023, captivating the hearts of fans and fashion enthusiasts alike. The red carpet sizzled with star power as Big Brother Naija star Diane and a constellation of six other Nigerian celebrities illuminated the event with their enchanting ensembles, each uniquely embodying the iconic Barbie theme. With a swirl of colours and a dash of whimsy, the premiere proved to be an unforgettable night of style and elegance.

item.title: Nine Aspirants To Contest APC Governorship Ticket In Abia
item.description: At least nine members of the All Progressive Congress (APC) in Abia State have declared interest in the party’s 2023 governorship ticket. Speaking in Umuahia on Friday, APC Chairman in the state, Acho Obioma, said the party leadership is making arrangements to meet with all the nine governorship aspirants next week Tuesday to finetune modalities for the forthcoming primaries. The party chieftain assured that the stakeholders will make a collective decision to arrive at the party’s flag bearer ahead of the 2023 elections in the state.

item.title: Ganduje Reveals Agenda For APC As National Chairman
item.description: The former Governor of Kano State, Abdullahi Ganduje on Thursday revealed his agenda for the All Progressives Congress (APC) if he emerges as the National Chairman of the party. Ganduje in his statement said he would emphasize membership drive if he becomes the national chairman. Naija News gathered that Ganduje made this claim when the youth Wing of the party under the leadership of National Youth Leader, Dayo Israel, together with Zonal Youth Leaders and all States Youth Leaders from 36 states and Abuja, visited him.

item.title: Okorocha Knocks Pastor Tunde Bakare For Saying Igbos Are Cursed
item.description: Former Governor of Imo State and Senator representing Imo West, Rochas Okorocha has slammed the General Overseer of Citadel Global Community Church, formerly known as Latter Rain Assembly, Pastor Tunde Bakare. Speaking on Tuesday when the National Youth Leader of the All Progressives Congress (APC), Dayo Israel, paid him a visit, Okorocha said Bakare was wrong form saying Igbos cannot rule Nigeria, because they are under a curse. He stated that people from the Southeast are an asset to the country.
